thread.title: Luis Enrique: Messi is Barca's leader, not Neymar
thread.title_full: Luis Enrique: Messi is Barca's leader, not Neymar

author: How Chicago police 'disappeared' 7,000 people
title: Luis Enrique: Messi is Barca's leader, not Neymar
text:
Luis Enrique: Messi is Barca's leader, not Neymar Goal.com 19 hrs ago © Provided by Goal.com Neymar will not be put under pressure to take the attacking burden left by Lionel Messi's injury absence, Barcelona coach Luis Enrique says.
AdChoices Barca is expected to remain without Messi's services until December, although Brazil captain Neymar showed signs of filling the Argentina superstar's boots with a four-goal haul in Saturday's 5-2 win over Rayo Vallecano at Camp Nou.
Speaking alongside his coach ahead of Tuesday's Champions League clash with BATE, Barca midfielder Sergio Busquets said: "Neymar has the capability to be a leader in the absence of Leo. He's one of those players who can make the team feel better."
But Luis Enrique was quick to take the pressure of being Barca's focal point in attack off Neymar's shoulders.
"We try to work as a group," the coach said. "We have our leader in Leo Messi — we cannot seek new leaders constantly."
Barca has kept just two clean sheets in all competitions this season, relying on outgunning its opponents as the club sits on top of its Champions League group and level on points with La Liga leader Real Madrid.
"What is important is our path throughout the season — we are aware that we need to improve," Luis Enrique added. "When we have a defensive situation in which we are conceding too many goals, it is not just a problem in the defense, but the entire team, starting with the coach. We never stop trying to find solutions as a group and we are working every week. In our last game I think the problems were solved."
